abstract: Many of China's wealthiest people hold positions in National People’s Congress or Chinese People’s Political Consultative Congress; legislative bodies wield no real power, but seats designate status as well as provide access to high-ranking Communist Party officials and offer protection from government actions.
lead_paragraph: Among the 1,271 richest Chinese people tracked by the Shanghai-based Hurun Report, 203 are delegates to the nation’s Parliament or its advisory body, which will convene jointly this week.

headline.main: Billionaire Lawmakers Ensure the Rich Are Represented in China’s Legislature
headline.print_headline: Billionaire Lawmakers Ensure the Rich Are Represented in China’s Legislature

snippet: Among the 1,271 richest Chinese people tracked by the Shanghai-based Hurun Report, 203 are delegates to the nation’s Parliament or its advisory body, which will convene jointly this week.
